root: ^Nessie waves her arms in front of you haphazardly, distracting you from the paperwork you had definitely not been putting off.
^You immediately realise how stupid that sounds given the context.
^Nessies face falls, clearly not taking the joke well.
^“No, it is NOT alright! You know how I went to look for my computer so I could show you my very declassified totally awesome plant facts????"
^“Before you ask, yes I have checked everywhere already."
^"I took in all my bags myself when I arrived and I could have sworn I had everything. Look, I even brought my bag-”
^She stops mid sentence, half way through pulling up some sort of luminous green rucksack onto your desk.
^It is dripping with water and you really hope she just keeps it where it is.
^Water damage on the desk would equal instant reprimands from your Boss.
^“I’m going to have to ask you not to put that on my desk.”
^Your request goes unheard as she’s still frozen, like someone hit the pause switch.
^Your mind drifts to images of lizards sleeping on hot rocks under the sun.
^“Why… is there a hole in the bottom of my bag.”
^“How am I supposed to research waterlogged logs if my research logs are all waterlogged?!!!”
^Uh oh. You suddenly remember her mentioning going through the lake to get here. The pieces are coming together.
^“Please tell me you have some sort of diving equipment."
^"I can’t swim below certain depths and I’ll be in major trouble if what I think has happened… has happened…”
^“Why would a Motel carry diving equipment??”

nodive: ^There is literally no way to lie your way out of this one. Better to be honest with her.
^“Sorry, we don’t carry anything like that.”
^“Oh Nettles. It was worth a shot.”
^She smiles sadly at you, as if expecting something more hopeful. You feel awful.
^“Do you want a hug or something?”
^“Aww, you’re so sweet! I’m a little too anxious at the moment and I don’t know you so well, but thanks anyway."
^"The offer itself makes me feel more cheerful already!”
playsilly: ^“Hmm last time I checked, we don’t carry anything like that. Foggy Lake has lots of other amenities though!”
^You do your best to put on a customer service smile, listing out all the things you can possibly think of that the Motel has.
^“We have dry cleaning services, complimentary lobby refreshments… room service…”
^“Sorry to interrupt, but none of this is what I’m looking for.”
^This must be the one and only time that technically fulfilling your job description has been utterly useless.
whymotel: ^“You’re literally sitting next to a giant lake, and the name of your Motel reaffirms this!!”
^“I don’t think my suggestion is that crazy.”
^Honestly when she puts it like that, you can see her point.
notlake: ^“Look, this situation isn’t ideal for me. As far as I can tell, all of my equipment is currently sitting at the bottom of your scenic lake.”
^“I’m currently working on this project to advance my rank as a junior researcher so it’s really important to me that I can fix this.”
^You notice she is spiraling further down into a panic. What do you think she needs right now?
sorrywet: ^You try your best to be helpfully unhelpful, reassuring Nessie that there should be some way to recover or replace her lost stuff.
^“My future is on the line here so of course I am going to come up with a plan… eventually.”
^“Thanks for your concern and understanding, receptionist!!”
^Her seemingly steadfast faith in your usefulness is flattering.
whyswim: ^“I don’t know, maybe because I am an amphibian who can’t travel long distances out in the open???”
^“Aw, I can’t really stay mad at you for not understanding.”
^“This is why I’m the scientist, and you are not.”
^She smiles, quickly forgetting your momentary insult. Thank goodness.
returnagain: ^“I won’t bother you all day about my issues, so I will come back once I actually have something you can help me with for real this time!”
^She cocks her head, looking behind you at something.
^“Ooh, you have a computer back there?? Cool!”
^“Guess I’ll see you around then. Byee!!”
^She runs off for the second time today. You really can’t keep up with her energy.
^Hopefully that equipment doesn’t put other tourists off using the lake. You’re sure there will be some way to recover it…
